properties.name: operation
properties.description: Create a bucket

options.name: Create
options.description: Create a bucket

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete a bucket

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many buckets

options.name: Search
options.description: Search within a bucket

properties.name: name
properties.description: A succinct description of the nature, symptoms, cause, or effect of the bucket

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: The canned ACL to apply to the bucket

options.name: acl
options.description: The canned ACL to apply to the bucket

options.name: bucketObjectLockEnabled
options.description: Whether you want S3 Object Lock to be enabled for the new bucket

options.name: grantFullControl
options.description: Whether to allow grantee the read, write, read ACP, and write ACP permissions on the bucket

options.name: grantRead
options.description: Whether to allow grantee to list the objects in the bucket

options.name: grantReadAcp
options.description: Whether to allow grantee to read the bucket ACL

options.name: grantWrite
options.description: Whether to allow grantee to create, overwrite, and delete any object in the bucket

options.name: grantWriteAcp
options.description: Whether to allow grantee to write the ACL for the applicable bucket

options.name: region
options.description: Region you want to create the bucket in, by default the buckets are created on the region defined on the credentials

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the AWS S3 bucket to delete

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: A delimiter is a character you use to group keys

options.name: delimiter
options.description: A delimiter is a character you use to group keys

options.name: encodingType
options.description: Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode object keys in the response

options.name: fetchOwner
options.description: The owner field is not present in listV2 by default, if you want to return owner field with each key in the result then set the fetch owner field to true

options.name: prefix
options.description: Limits the response to keys that begin with the specified prefix

options.name: requesterPays
options.description: Whether the requester will pay for requests and data transfer. While Requester Pays is enabled, anonymous access to this bucket is disabled.

options.name: startAfter
options.description: StartAfter is where you want Amazon S3 to start listing from. Amazon S3 starts listing after this specified key.

properties.name: operation
properties.description: Create a folder

options.name: Create
options.description: Create a folder

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete a folder

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many folders

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: Parent folder you want to create the folder in

options.name: parentFolderKey
options.description: Parent folder you want to create the folder in

options.name: requesterPays
options.description: Whether the requester will pay for requests and data transfer. While Requester Pays is enabled, anonymous access to this bucket is disabled.

options.name: storageClass
options.description: Amazon S3 storage classes

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.name: options
properties.description: The owner field is not present in listV2 by default, if you want to return owner field with each key in the result then set the fetch owner field to true

options.name: fetchOwner
options.description: The owner field is not present in listV2 by default, if you want to return owner field with each key in the result then set the fetch owner field to true

properties.name: operation
properties.description: Copy a file

options.name: Copy
options.description: Copy a file

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete a file

options.name: Download
options.description: Download a file

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many files

options.name: Upload
options.description: Upload a file

properties.name: sourcePath
properties.description: The name of the source bucket should start with (/) and key name of the source object, separated by a slash (/)

properties.name: destinationPath
properties.description: The name of the destination bucket and key name of the destination object, separated by a slash (/)

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: The canned ACL to apply to the object

options.name: acl
options.description: The canned ACL to apply to the object

options.name: grantFullControl
options.description: Whether to give the grantee READ, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the object

options.name: grantRead
options.description: Whether to allow grantee to read the object data and its metadata

options.name: grantReadAcp
options.description: Whether to allow grantee to read the object ACL

options.name: grantWriteAcp
options.description: Whether to allow grantee to write the ACL for the applicable object

options.name: lockLegalHold
options.description: Whether a legal hold will be applied to this object

options.name: lockMode
options.description: The Object Lock mode that you want to apply to this object

options.name: lockRetainUntilDate
options.description: The date and time when you want this object's Object Lock to expire

options.name: metadataDirective
options.description: Specifies whether the metadata is copied from the source object or replaced with metadata provided in the request

options.name: requesterPays
options.description: Whether the requester will pay for requests and data transfer. While Requester Pays is enabled, anonymous access to this bucket is disabled.

options.name: serverSideEncryption
options.description: The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3

options.name: serverSideEncryptionContext
options.description: Specifies the AWS KMS Encryption Context to use for object encryption

options.displayName: Server Side Encryption AWS KMS Key ID
options.name: encryptionAwsKmsKeyId
options.description: If x-amz-server-side-encryption is present and has the value of aws:kms

options.name: serversideEncryptionCustomerAlgorithm
options.description: Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (for example, AES256)

options.name: serversideEncryptionCustomerKey
options.description: Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data

options.displayName: Server Side Encryption Customer Key MD5
options.name: serversideEncryptionCustomerKeyMD5
options.description: Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321

options.name: storageClass
options.description: Amazon S3 storage classes

options.name: taggingDirective
options.description: Specifies whether the metadata is copied from the source object or replaced with metadata provided in the request

properties.name: fileName
properties.description: If not set the binary data filename will be used

properties.name: binaryData
properties.description: Whether the data to upload should be taken from binary field

properties.name: fileContent
properties.description: The text content of the file to upload

properties.name: binaryPropertyName
properties.hint: The name of the input binary field containing the file to be uploaded

hints.text: The name of the input binary field containing the file to be uploaded
The name of the output binary field to put the file in

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Stop Workflow
options.description: Halt execution and fail workflow

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
